name: St. Joseph of Arimathea

locations.description: Member of the Sanhedrin, provided tomb for Jesus

summary: Joseph of Arimathea was a wealthy member of the Sanhedrin and a secret disciple of Jesus. After the Crucifixion, he courageously went to Pilate to request Jesus' body. He provided his own new tomb for the burial of Jesus, fulfilling the prophecy that the Messiah would be buried with the rich. According to tradition, he later traveled to Britain, bringing Christianity to the British Isles.
